column2: TEXAS DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column8: to turn on your windshield wipers.
column10: to look for road edge markings to guide you.

column2: 2. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column6: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column8: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column10: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.

column2: 3. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column6: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column8: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column10: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column6: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column8: Sharp right turn
column10: A road joins from the left

column2: 5. This sign indicates:
column8: Do not use your phone while driving

column2: 6. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column6: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column8: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column10: you may stop to let out passengers.

column2: 7. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
column8: your emergency flashers

column2: 8. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column8: .05% or higher.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn permitted on red light
column8: No U-turns

column2: 10. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column6: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column8: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column10: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column8: Do not enter
column10: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 12. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: watch for this species crossing the road.
column8: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
column10: be ready to hit a reindeer.

column2: 13. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column8: turn off all your lights.
column10: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column8: Do not enter

column2: 15. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column8: green; white

column2: 16. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column6: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column8: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 17. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column8: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 18. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column8: move as far away from traffic as possible.

column2: 19. This sign means:
column4: Stay on the main highway if possible
column8: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 20. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column10: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column6: You must make a complete stop
column8: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles

column2: 22. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
column8: Drinking coffee

column2: 23. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column6: stay in the driverâ€™s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column8: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column10: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.

column2: 24. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column8: that a divided highway ends

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
column6: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection
column8: Wrong Way
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column6: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column8: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.

column2: 27. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column6: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 28. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column8: one hour.

column2: 29. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column6: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column8: race on empty roads.
column10: share the lane with another vehicle.

column2: 30. This sign means:
column6: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.
column8: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
